97.heading: Demosthenes.
97.title: "A Place in the World"
97.author: Gardner Fox, script
notes: "Roll Call: Hawkman, Green Lantern, Flash, Dr. Midnite, Wildcat, Johnny Thunder, Wonder Woman (secretary)."

Summary: In a story done with the cooperation of the National Society for Crippled Children and Adults, an athletic young man with a little brother in a wheelchair is wounded in battle. While in the hospital he realises the bad effect of being pitied. He asks the Justice Society to help prove that partially disabled people are not helpless. The Society divides up: "They have to make six individuals overcome their handicaps, as well as overcome six crimes." The story ends with a pledge, and a list of "great people who made their mark in spite of physical handicaps:" Franklin Delano Roosevelt, Helen Keller, Milton, Demosthenes, and Beethoven.
Data from Jerry Bails.
